Delhi: A fire broke out at a godown of a lumber store in Sonia Gandhi camp in Samalkha Kapashera area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 16 fire tender rushed to the spot and the operation to the douse the blaze is underway. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far. \"As soon as the information was received, as may as 16 fire engines reached the spot,\" said Satpal Bhardwaj, Divisional Officer, Fire Department, Delhi. \"It was a lumber store. The fire will be extinguished soon. No casualty has been reported so far,\" he added. Meanwhile, there is no information about the cause of the fire so far. Further details are awaited. The fire was reported around 12.20 pm from the second-floor flat of the Shiv Shakti society in Sector 71, Chief Fire Officer (CFO) Pradeep Choubey said.\"Taking quick action on the information, firefighters were rushed to the site and the fire was soon completely extinguished. There was no loss of life in the episode,\" Choubey said.Citing primary investigation by the fire officials, the CFO said that there was no one present inside the apartment at the time of the incident and the blaze appeared to have been triggered by a lit prayer lamp kept in the balcony.\"In recent times, we have seen around a dozen cases in which unattended prayer lamps inside homes have triggered fires. One such incident came to light when a 50-litre can of acid was found inside a women’s public toilet outside the GB Pant Hospital in Delhi’s Daryaganj. The can of acid was found during a surprise inspection by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chairperson Swati Maliwal. DCW officials also said that the acid was kept in open without any lid or cover. After the surprise inspection, the DCW officials called the police and confiscated the acid.The DCW chief took to Twitter to share a video where she can be seen scolding the staffers and management for being irresponsible. Maliwal said, “We are asking MCD [Municipal Corporation of Delhi] about the availability of acid in public toilets and to fix accountability on how this was allowed. Strict action will be taken against those involved.”DCW chairperson Maliwal said that if acid continues to remain easily available, it can pose a threat to women safety and is dangerous for anyone.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Delhi Women Commission confiscates acid can from women’s public toilet in Daryaganj","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Delhi","titleforurl":"delhi women commission confiscates acid can from women’s public toilet in daryaganj","synopsis":"The can of acid was found during a surprise inspection by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chairperson Swati Maliwal. main.articleBody: New Delhi: A fire broke out at a godown of a lumber store in Sonia Gandhi camp in Samalkha Kapashera area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 16 fire tender rushed to the spot and the operation to the douse the blaze is underway. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far. "As soon as the information was received, as may as 16 fire engines reached the spot," said Satpal Bhardwaj, Divisional Officer, Fire Department, Delhi. "It was a lumber store. The fire will be extinguished soon. No casualty has been reported so far," he added. Meanwhile, there is no information about the cause of the fire so far. Further details are awaited.
main.headline: Video | Delhi: Fire Breaks Out in Godown of Lumber Store in Sonia Gandhi Camp
main.keywords: sonia gandhi,Sonia Gandhi camp,delhi,Kapashera,satpal bhardwaj,fire department,fire news,

text: New Delhi: A fire broke out at a godown of a lumber store in Sonia Gandhi camp in Samalkha Kapashera area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 16 fire tender rushed to the spot and the operation to the douse the blaze is underway. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far. "As soon as the information was received, as may as 16 fire engines reached the spot," said Satpal Bhardwaj, Divisional Officer, Fire Department, Delhi. "It was a lumber store. The fire will be extinguished soon. No casualty has been reported so far," he added. Meanwhile, there is no information about the cause of the fire so far. Further details are awaited.
title: Video | Delhi: Fire Breaks Out in Godown of Lumber Store in Sonia Gandhi Camp
